item.title: Council member Shadid prepares Open Meeting Act lawsuit against City of Okla City
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
The attorney for Oklahoma City Ward 2 Councilman Ed Shadid is drafting a lawsuit against the City of Oklahoma City over possible violations of the Oklahoma Open Meeting Act. Shadid is ratcheting up his long-standing criticism of City Manager Jim Couch and others over the practice of dividing the Council into smaller groups out of […]

The post Council member Shadid prepares Open Meeting Act lawsuit against City of Okla City appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: City senator has painful connection to 1921 Tulsa Race Riot
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Tuesday, east-side Oklahoma City senator Anastasia Pittman recalled the damage done to her family by the 1921 Tulsa race riot, and so, was happy to see a new curriculum about it. Pittman, who is black, told Free Press that her grandfather narrowly escaped the violence of the riot, one of the bloodiest events in the […]

The post City senator has painful connection to 1921 Tulsa Race Riot appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Democrats take stand, stall Oklahoma House budget vote
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Dueling news conferences at the Oklahoma Capitol Wednesday revealed deep divisions between Democrats and Republicans over how to resolve a budget deficit of $900 million projected for next year. The Legislature has only 12 more days to go before the deadline to pass a budget. A House bill proposed by majority Republicans to whittle down […]

The post Democrats take stand, stall Oklahoma House budget vote appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Brooks-Jimenez already knocking doors in Senate District 44
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
To follow Michael Brooks-Jimenez from door to door in Oklahoma Senate District 44, it seems that he intuitively senses whether to use English or Spanish as soon as he begins to shake hands. But thatâ€™s not surprising. He grew up on the south side of the city in the district where Spanish and English languages […]
